TBH I would think so but I don't know for sure. That aside, the timing could not be any more suspicious and the whole world knows it.
EDIT: Yes, he was originally scheduled to [meet with Tillerson instead to discuss Ukraine, Syria, and bilateral issues](http://www.cnn.com/2017/05/09/politics/trump-lavrov-meeting/index.html)

WRITING.TITLE: Trump to meet with Russian foreign minister on Wednesday after terminating Comey and grand jury subpoenas issued in FBI's Russia investigation
Trump to meet with Russian foreign minister on Wednesday
Trump to meet Russian foreign minister Lavrov on Wednesday

WRITING.TEXT: It sucks. I love Reddit but I don't understand how the thousands of people upvoting this stuff don't seem to think about it. I see 11k upvotes and all I can think about are my parents sharing their unsubstantiated pro-Trump internet essays (read propaganda) on Facebook.
My thoughts exactly. Regardless of personal politics, these are effectively all just opinion sites that seem to only exist to smear the "other team".
Serious question: how are news sources like Salon any better than Breitbart or Drudge Report?

**Spicer stopped short of suggesting that the Obama administration deserved blame** for re-upping Flynns clearance in 2016 despite his paid speaking gig in Russia.
Because Trump's die-hard supporters will do that for him.
But **he did explain that the Trump administration had not run its own check on Flynn, assuming that the Obama-era security clearance would have been sufficient.**
What was it you were saying about Donny's "intuition"?
We trust that when you were cleared the first time, if you were cleared on December 15th or January 20th, that you were still -- that your background check still cleared. Every individual [who] came into this White House either applied for a security clearance or had one. Spicer said. Why would you rerun a background check on someone who was the head of the Department of Defense intelligence agency that had and did maintain a high-level security clearance?
Do you and Spicey also feel this way about Hillary's security clearance?

The fact that the president is a billionaire is irrelevant and using someone's net worth as a gauge for their job performance is [completely wrong](http://uk.businessinsider.com/most-popular-politician-in-the-us-bernie-sanders-fox-news-poll-2017-3?r=US IR=T)
